summary: The project manager recapped the decisions made in the previous meeting. The marketing expert discussed his findings from trend watching reports, stressing the need for a product that has a fancy look and feel, is technologically innovative, is easy to use, and incorporates some aspect of fruit and vegetables in its design. The interface specialist presented research on the appearance of current remotes, concluding that current remotes are generally unappealing in terms of look and usability. The interface specialist presented ideas on how to remedy the unappealing aspects of current remotes in the team's design and also how to incorporate the corporate color scheme into the design. The industrial designer presented options for materials, components, and batteries and discussed the restrictions involved in using certain materials. The team then discussed options for the shape and color scheme of the remote, as well as what components, batteries, and materials to use.
actions: Some team members will design a prototype of the remote
decisions: The remote will be curvy. The remote will be shaped like a snowman. The remote will not have a talk-back function. The remote will have a jog dial. The materials used will be plastic and rubber. The case will have a soft fruit-like feel to it. The remote will not have an LCD display. The remote will have a kinetic battery. The remote will have rubber buttons.
problems: What sort of battery to use. How to incorporate a fruit and vegetable theme, the corporate color, and soft materials into the remote. What shape the remote should be. Whether the remote should have a talk-back function. Whether to have an LCD display on the remote. What the case will look like. Whether to include a jog dial on the remote.

doc.content:
Final Report



Decisions made in Kick-Off Meeting:



	Product should control multiple devices, eg VCR, DVD, Stereo, etc 

	Product should look good/trendy 



Decisions made in Functional Design Meeting:



	Which requirements were essential, and which were “ideal”

	Target group = 15-35 age bracket 

	Use of speech recognition - yes

	Product powered by conventional, non-rechargeable batteries

	Grouping products functions into 3 categories - audio, video & other



Decisions made in Conceptual Design Meeting:



	Product will be made of plastic & rubber 

	"Snowman" shape 

	Gimmicky backlighting and LEDs inside case

	No need for "talk back" or LCD

	Jog dial to be incorporated 

	Corporate colour (yellow) to feature heavily in design

	Corporate slogan to feature on product

	

Decisions made in Detailed Design Meeting:



	Due to financial restraints, the LCD & advanced chip were removed from the design

	The final prototype was produced.

	

	Final Design:

	

	The final design is a “snow man” shape, of dimensions 10x3x2.5 cm.

	The materials used are yellow, blue and red plastic.

	Push buttons and an integrated scroll wheel/ pushbutton were used for input.

	The company’s logo and slogan are printed on the device.

	Batteries are the only power source.

	Functionalities are: Volume control, Power on/off, visual settings (brightness, contrast), channel tuning, auxiliary input settings, sounds settings (bass, treble, balance, pre-programmed sound modes).

	Cost of final design is 12.4 euros.

Minutes of the Meeting of Real Reaction



12.00 pm

13.12.04

Meeting Room



Present: 	David

		Craig

		Andrew

		Laura



Laura brought the new project requirements to the attention of the team.

David, Craig and Andrew delivered their presentations.

The following decisions were made:



The target group for the project will be 15-35 year olds.

The functionalities of the remote control will be divided into 3 categories: audio, video and other.

Speech recognition will be implemented as part of the user interface.

The remote control will be powered by conventional, non-rechargeable batteries.

Minutes of the Meeting of Real Reaction



14.10 pm

13.12.04

Meeting Room



Present: 	David

		Craig

		Andrew

		Laura



David, Craig and Andrew gave their presentations.

Discussion of the following topics took place:



Shape of product – “snowman shaped”

Colour – predominantly yellow

Corporate slogan to feature on product casing

Plastic & rubber to be used

Back-lighting for buttons and LEDs to shine through casing

A jog dial to be implemented for scrolling through channels

No need for either a “talk back” function or an LCD

Power to be kinetic, with battery back up.

Minutes of the Meeting of Real Reaction



15.30 pm

13.12.04

Meeting Room



Present: 	David

		Craig

		Andrew

		Laura



The prototype was presented and discussed.

The evaluation criteria were discussed.

The production cost of the remote control was calculated, and some design features (LCD & extra material) were removed to keep to the budget.

The design process was evaluated:



Room for creativity: financial and time constraints meant that creative process was a bit confined.  A more relaxed environment (without headsets, etc) might have been more conducive to creativity.

Leadership: personal coach, project manager, etc meant for a lot of structure – perhaps too much.

Team work: would have been easier if we could have communicated outside meetings.  Tools available to us didn’t really support collaboration.  The actual work involved was quite isolated.

Means: would have preferred to use the whiteboard more, and powerpoint less.  Too many presentations.  Digital pens are quite chunky but easy enough to use.  Computers provided distraction in meetings.  Play dough very useful.

Minutes of the Meeting of Real Reaction



11.00 am

13.12.04

Meeting Room



Present: 	David

		Craig

		Andrew

		Laura



The team introduced themselves to each other.

The team familiarised themselves with the equipment, e.g. whiteboard, microphones, projectors.

Project finances were discussed, e.g. production costs and selling price.

The following topics were discussed:



The product may be vary in popularity according to geographical area because of its price.

Technical query – do we need to consider different zones (like DVD regions)

In present market, what kind of remote control can be bought for 25 euro?

Want product to control multiple devices.

Extra functionalities could include controlling lighting, making  notes about programmes you want to watch.

Personal experiences with remote controls – easily lost.

Want product to look “chic”

Realise that extra functionalities that could provide “selling points” will be restricted by production cost.
